thread.title: Texas Teacher Won’t Lose Teaching License For Pot Use In Colorado
thread.title_full: Texas Teacher Won’t Lose Teaching License For Pot Use In Colorado

author: CBS Denver
title: Texas Teacher Won’t Lose Teaching License For Pot Use In Colorado
text:
Texas Teacher Won’t Lose Teaching License For Pot Use In Colorado January 30, 2017 9:16 PM 
DENVER (CBS4) – A Texas teacher who got in trouble for using marijuana in Colorado has won a court ruling. 
A judge ruled the state of Texas cannot take away Maryam Roland’s teaching license. 
Roland admitted she had an edible while visiting Colorado back in 2015. A hair test from her employer later found she consumed marijuana sometime over a six-month period. Marijuana edibles (credit: CBS) 
A judge ruled there was no evidence to suggest she ever did the drug in Texas and said she should not be sanctioned for her actions in Colorado.
